item.title: SSL Certificate expiration
item.content:encoded: SSL Certificate have expired and cause errors on media-req platform.

item.title: Rack maintenance
item.content:encoded: Rack is being recabled and have wheels, which needs a complete shutdown to do so.

item.title: Collect router failure
item.content:encoded: Hardware failure on collect router caused major network outage on all infrastructure.

item.title: Electrical failure
item.content:encoded: A power outage caused most servers to go down, then broke the measurement tool, causing the rest of the servers (on UPS) to also shutdown.

item.title: Storage upgrade
item.content:encoded: Storage server is upgraded to a more recent and performant one, causing downtime for Plex and Media Factory.

item.title: Storage system is down
item.content:encoded:
The Storage server system board crashed, and the server won't go up. Replacement part are purchased and should be available soon.

2020-07-01T12:00:00.000Z
Replacement parts arrived

Replacement came, supplier sent a defective part and doesn't have any other one in stock.
A brand new server has been purchased today and should arrive in 3-5 days.

2020-07-04T12:00:00.000Z
Resolved

A new motherboard came in and works fine. Storage system is up again.

item.title: Requested contents are not available in Plex
item.content:encoded:
We reached the maximum number of files allowed in a single Google Drive Enterprise shared folder, which can cause some content to be unavailable on Plex (while it is on Plex-OSC).
Remediations are in progress but could take some time.
